definition: Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961), American novelist and journalist
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
power/might/prestige

sentences.english: Hemmingway's study was at the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 後面一座是海明威的書房。

sentences.english: Hemingway enjoyed his lunches at the Course Restaurant, which is still functioning.
sentences.chinese: 海明威喜歡在賽場的餐廳喫飯，這家餐廳仍然在營業。

sentences.english: This is a reflection of Hemingways stubborn pessimism.
sentences.chinese: 這是海明威式的固執的悲觀主義情結的反映。

sentences.english: Hemingway was as handsome as a film star , Bogart as sophisticated as a writer .
sentences.chinese: 海明威英俊好比影星，而鮑嘉睿智有如作家。

sentences.english: In 1954 Hemingway won Nabel literary award.
Then Pauline fell in love with Hemingway.
sentences.chinese: 然後寶蓮愛上了海明威的愛情。

sentences.english: The Hemingwayian tough man spirit lightens the literary arena in the whole world in an era.
sentences.chinese: 海明威式的硬漢精神照亮了一個時代的世界文壇。

sentences.english: In Key West, I can just find a trace of his legendary life.
sentences.chinese: 海明威傳奇的一生幾乎在這裏都可以找到遺留的痕跡。

sentences.english: Hemmingway's work is admired by many people.
sentences.chinese: 許多人都喜歡海明威的作品。

sentences.english: Hemingway is a writer of remarkable genius.
sentences.chinese: 海明威是才華橫溢的作家。

sentences.english: Many of Hemingway's heroses love bullfight.
sentences.chinese: 海明威的許多主人翁喜歡鬥牛。

sentences.english: Hemingway 's plainspoken no-frills writing style became so famous that it was (and is) frequently parodied.
sentences.chinese: 海明威直率的寫作風格常常成爲其他作家模仿的對象。

sentences.english: Hemingway portrays many "the dauntless man" image.
sentences.chinese: 海明威塑造出許多“硬漢子”的形象。

sentences.english: She was the first one to open my eyes to Hemingway, Faulkner, and other literary giants.
sentences.chinese: 是她帶我進入海明威和福克納等文學巨匠的世界。

sentences.english: You won’t soon forget the Hemingway Daiquiri or the Honeysuckle.
sentences.chinese: 你不會馬上就忘記海明威臺克利酒或是金銀花香。

sentences.english: Hemingway came back to Ketchum, but couldn't write anymore.
sentences.chinese: 海明威回到了凱徹姆，但他卻再也無力寫作了。

William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Marcel Proust (1871-1922), French author
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Jorge Luis Borges
George Bernard Shaw (1856-1950), Irish dramatist and writer
